meanings.definition: A roof with two slopes on all sides, the lower slope being steeper than the upper one.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a mansard roof that made it look unique.
meanings.sent2: The mansard of the building added a touch of elegance to its design.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest under the mansard, thinking it was a cozy spot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a mansard, with thoughts sliding down the steep slope.
meanings.sent5: The painter captured the beauty of the mansard in his artwork.

meanings.definition: A style of roof characterized by two slopes on all sides, with the lower slope being steeper than the upper one.
meanings.sent1: The historic district is known for its mansard roofs that stand out.
meanings.sent2: Architects often use the mansard style to give buildings a classic look.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed up the mansard roof, pretending to be a skilled mountaineer.
meanings.sent4: His dreams reached new heights, like a mansard soaring above the city.
meanings.sent5: The storm rattled the windows of the house with the mansard roof.
